CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 1, 1958, pg. 16 reads: "Alpha Hold Smoker - Following the Pitt-Army football game, last Saturday, Alpha Phi Alpha Omicron Lambda Chapter held one of its traditional smokers at the fraternity house. The usual fun-fare, including tasty food, refreshments and oratory so familiar to all brothers who have been privileged to "cross the burning sands," was the order of the evening.  Brother Wilbur Douglas, second from left, first row, chapter secretary for 30 years, has enjoyed many an Alpha smoker.  Forrest L. Parr, president, second from left, third row; Paul Williams, second from left, second row, and Charles Angall [Angell], third from left, fourth row, headed the committee. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Alpha Phi Alpha fraternity members, including first row: Wilbur Douglas second from left; second row: Paul Williams second from left; third row: Forrest L. Parr second from left; and fourth row: Charles Angell third from left, gathered in Alpha Phi Alpha fraternity house for Pitt - Army football game
